Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 02:45PM Carol03 wrote: Waiting is the hardest part.  I wish that once the doctor found something "suspicous" on your mamogram, they could do the biopsy right there.  That would decress the anxiety in waiting to have the procedure done and than for the results.  I had my annual mamo the end of Feb., was called back a few days later to have more magnified views done for microcalcifications.  That was scheduled for a week later, which radiologist said I would need a biopsy for "intermidiate microcalcifications."  My biopsy was than scheuled 3 weeks later.  Had that done on 4/4, which wasn't as bad as I had anticipated, but decided that only a man could have come up with that procedure!  I got my results yesterday, which came back benign.  While waiting, I tried to keep myself busy with photo albums and anything else that might take my mind off of the possiblity of having cancer.  I told one friend and my sister, who were a great comfort to me.  I didn't want to say anything to my 3 children or my parents, until I knew either way.  I figured I was doing enough worrying for everyone. I will be thinking of you ladies and wishing you good thoughts. Carol
Posts.Title: Newbie here, waiting on biopsy results iaksma slcst12

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2008 09:12PM - edited Apr 6, 2008 09:13PM by Carol03 I am new to this site and have pretty much read everyones stories.  It helps to read them, so thanks!  I too was diagnosed with microcalcifications and had to have a sterotactic biopsy on Friday.  Was not as bad as I had anticipated.  I had to wait a very long month to finally have it done, I was a wreck.  Waiting to get results.  Doctor who performed biopsy said that the calcifications appeared to be on the surface of my left breast, in a straight line and in a liquid form.  Does anyone know what that means? Thanks Carol
Posts.Title: CALCIFICATIONS??? heartbroken1 leaf
